column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////After falling in love with Ramen Tatsuya in Austin
column2: I had to give this place a try. Overall I was very pleased. I had the takoyaki
column3: which I have never had before
column4: and it was delicious. Then I ate the Tonkatsu black with the spicy ground pork added into it. The ramen was pretty great also. I felt like the egg could have been better though. It was a little overcooked
column5: and the flavor just did not compare to the marinated egg at Ramen Tatsuya. Overall I'd like to go back and possibly try something different and see if this place can't earn my 5th star
column6: but as for now it falls just a little short of deserving it.
